artist: Artist: Katsukawa Shun'ei; Publisher: Nishimuraya Yohachi
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
markings: Censor seal: 極 {kiwame}; publisher\'s seal: {Eijudō}; date seal: 弐
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: Tamagaki Gakunosuke (1768-1813) was with 6 feet very tall and came from Nagasaki to Edo in 1789. He changed his name several times and this portrait was released at the time of the tournament in the second month 1806 when he began to use the name Tamagaki Gakunosuke. He is shown very relaxed in a loosely tied robe, smoking his pipe.
title: The Sumo Wrestler Tamagaki Gakunosuke
